content.description:
While climbing this one I commented to my belayer how amazingly steep this one was for only 11a! 

  Scramble up the easy slab and reach high for the first bolt.  From here sequential moves on great holds, set you up for the crux.  Continue past on ever steepening ground on jugs, pull out of the steepness and onto the face.  Head on the left side of the last bolt up to the anchors.
content.location: Starts between Bonehead and Crazy Bone.  2nd really steep route from the left.

content.description: Blocky face moves for a couple bolts lead to a small stance, then crimpy face moves on a sparsely featured face.
content.location: The first line left of Milk Bone, to the left and outside of the alcove.

content.description: Fun face climbing to a big bulge. Crux is pulling the bulge.
Cruiser face, to very thin face moves.

This is basically a boulder problem (V0+, V1 or so) to huge jugs, but it's pretty keen. Power up to the stacked blocks that make up the key handlebar hold. There's still some friable crud under your feet on the overhanging part, so take caution.
content.location: On the left flank of the Bonetown "cave," before the new slab routes. Look for the stumpy remains of what was a prickly, crotch-nibbling bush at the base (a crag gardener has since cut it down.)

content.description: Tough first move crux leads to gentle overhang on jug ledges, finishes at anchors just below large ocotillo at top of cliff.
content.location: First route you approach when you walk up the hill from the creek.  Next route to the right of Fried Neck Bones.

content.description: Face climbing to a crack.  Anchors are above the crack.
content.location: Third route in from the right side of Bone Town.  Left of Normal Like You.

content.description: Deceiving line up to a diving board under roof. Shake it out and pull strenuous move into dihedral.
Overhanging start to some nice long moves between big holds.
content.location: Between Crynoid Arete and Tuskin Raider.

content.description: A steep hard start with some very thin crimping leads to a mellow romp to the anchors on cool jugs.  Some consider this the finest route on the wall, but I thought Wish Bone was better.
content.location: Leftmost route at Bonetown.  To the right is "Entrance Fee".

content.description: Something to do if you have exhausted all of the climbs in this area and want a new route. Combines some of the best elements of the 3 routes on the nice overhanging face. Start on Bonehead and clip the first 2 bolts before climbing right to the 3rd bolt on Wishbone and continue rightward finishing on the last 2 bolts of Crazy Bone.
content.protection: 5 bolts to rings. Rope drag is not that bad but cleaning can be rough. I suggest cleaning the final 3 bolts then lower and climb/clean Bonehead.

content.description: Very similar to Wish Bone and Bonehead. Good holds and good movement in the inverted section to a short face and anchors.
content.location: Just to the right of Wish Bone.

content.description: Thin start on crimps to a right hand side pull up to a blocky pinch. Midway through the route the moves start taking you slightly to the left.

Something to do if you have exhausted all of the other routes in this area or you just really enjoy the climbing on this steep face. Start on Crazy Bone, clipping the first 2 bolts before heading left to the third clip on Wishbone and continue left to finish up the final 2 bolts of Bonehead.
content.protection: 5 bolts to rings. Rope drag is not to bad but cleaning can be rough. I suggest cleaning the last 3 bolts then lower and climb/clean Crazy Bone.

content.description:
Just like the original route Wishbone only with smaller holds and a little steeper, and a little harder grade. 

  Start up the slab to clip the first bolt, may want to stick clip as the clipping hold wasn't great (I'd guess about a 10c clip).  Continue up the steep ground through jugs and some smaller holds.  At the top look left for the 5th bolt, make some cool moves to it, and pull one last tricky move to get onto the hanging face.
content.protection: 5 Bolts to Anchors, Stick Clip if desired.
content.location: Between Milk Bone and Wish Bone.  First steep route from the left.  Also is the only route with all black hangers.

content.description: Bone Town sits just Northeast of the Welcome Wall, on the East side of the riverbed. It faces mostly north.
